intro: Ebenus inconstans, commonly known as the variable buckthorn, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of western Asia. It is a member of the Rutaceae family, which includes citrus plants, and is characterized by its aromatic leaves and yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in open woodlands or along roadsides. Its fruits are small, fleshy berries that contain seeds, and the plant is known for its variable appearance depending on environmental conditions. Ebenus inconstans is also valued for its medicinal properties in traditional herbal remedies.
